intro: Neopentanisia annua, commonly known as the annual neopentanisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in disturbed soils. Due to its rapid life cycle, it is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
